text: Gary Sadler (born 1962), is a male retired cyclist who competed for England. ==Cycling career== He represented England in the 1 km time trial and won a bronze medal in the 4,000 metres team pursuit with Darryl Webster, Shaun Wallace, Tony Mayer and Paul Curran, at the 1982 Commonwealth Games in Brisbane, Queensland, Australia. Sadler was a six times British track champion, winning the British National Individual Sprint Championships in 1988, the British National Individual Time Trial Championships in 1980 & 1982, the British National Team Pursuit Championships in 1980, the in British National Scratch Championships in 1982 and the British National Keirin Championships in 1988. ==References== Category:1962 births Category:English male cyclists Category:Commonwealth Games medallists in cycling Category:Commonwealth Games bronze medallists for England Category:Cyclists at the 1982 Commonwealth Games Category:Living people
title: Gary Sadler
